Package ball.ballAgent

Class Ball

java.lang.Object
ball.ballAgent.Ball
All Implemented Interfaces:

public class Ball extends Object implements Entity
This is the structure of the ball, described by: - A trajectory - A two dimensional position

  • Method Details

    • updatePos

      public void updatePos()
      Updates the position of the ball, basing the calculations on Projectile Motion'sequations.

    • applyConstraints

      public void applyConstraints(double position, Boundary bound)
      Whenever the ball hits a wall, this method will be called. It's necessary to pass as argument a postion (double beetween -1 and 1) because floating point precision cause bad bugs when displaying the ball bouncing in wall. In ConstraintCheck.checkConstraints(BallAgent) there are small variations in X1 and Y1 axis and thanks to those values, when hitting the wall the transition in the other direction is smoother. NOTE: In MacOS Y1 limit is below the frame of the gui, and for avoiding seeing the ball disappear under the Y1 boundary, i've added a bigger offset than X1.
      Parameters:
      position - the position that the ball need to occupy in this moment.
      bound - Y or X boundary, needed by this method to determinate wich velocity (Horizontal or Vertical) to invert.

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Description copied from interface: Entity
      We got to define how to return the space occupied by an entity. We could try to design everything as a square and return the area to be calculated from the position occupied by it.
      Specified by:
      getSize in interface Entity
      Returns:
      the area of the space occupied
